availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Rebecca Hall Woolfolk (Ballard County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, resident. Hickman County, Kentucky, native. Married to John Woolfolk in Ballard County, Kentucky, in March 1858. Mother of Thomas P. Woolfolk, Laura O. Woolfolk, Ellen Woolfolk, and John Woolfolk. Resident of Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 593.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 43A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 5, p. 438B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll 994027, Ballard County Marriages.
